026import java.io.IOException;
027import java.nio.ByteBuffer;

076@Category(LargeTests.class)
077@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
078public class TestIncrementalBackup extends TestBackupBase {
079
080  @ClassRule
081  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
082    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestIncrementalBackup.class);
083
084  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestIncrementalBackup.class);
085  private static final byte[] BULKLOAD_START_KEY = new byte[] { 0x00 };
086  private static final byte[] BULKLOAD_END_KEY = new byte[] { Byte.MAX_VALUE };
087
088  @Parameterized.Parameters
089  public static Collection<Object[]> data() {
090    provider = "multiwal";
091    List<Object[]> params = new ArrayList<>();
092    params.add(new Object[] { Boolean.TRUE });
093    return params;
094  }
095
096  public TestIncrementalBackup(Boolean b) {
097  }
098
099  @After
100  public void ensurePreviousBackupTestsAreCleanedUp() throws Exception {
101    TEST_UTIL.flush(table1);
102    TEST_UTIL.flush(table2);
103    TEST_UTIL.flush(table1_restore);
104
105    TEST_UTIL.truncateTable(table1).close();
106    TEST_UTIL.truncateTable(table2).close();
107    TEST_UTIL.truncateTable(table1_restore).close();
108
109    TEST_UTIL.getMiniHBaseCluster().getRegionServerThreads().forEach(rst -> {
110      try {
111        LogRoller walRoller = rst.getRegionServer().getWalRoller();
112        walRoller.requestRollAll();
113        walRoller.waitUntilWalRollFinished();
114      } catch (Exception ignored) {
115      }
116    });
117
118    try (Table table = TEST_UTIL.getConnection().getTable(table1)) {
119      loadTable(table);
120    }
121
122    try (Table table = TEST_UTIL.getConnection().getTable(table2)) {
123      loadTable(table);
124    }
125  }
126
127  // implement all test cases in 1 test since incremental
128  // backup/restore has dependencies
129  @Test
130  public void TestIncBackupRestore() throws Exception {
131    int ADD_ROWS = 99;
132
133    // #1 - create full backup for all tables
134    LOG.info("create full backup image for all tables");
135    List<TableName> tables = Lists.newArrayList(table1, table2);
136    final byte[] fam3Name = Bytes.toBytes("f3");
137    final byte[] mobName = Bytes.toBytes("mob");
138
139    TableDescriptor newTable1Desc = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(table1Desc)
140      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam3Name))
141      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(mobName).setMobEnabled(true)
142        .setMobThreshold(5L).build())
143      .build();
144    TEST_UTIL.getAdmin().modifyTable(newTable1Desc);
145
146    try (Connection conn = ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf1)) {
147      int NB_ROWS_FAM3 = 6;
148      insertIntoTable(conn, table1, fam3Name, 3, NB_ROWS_FAM3).close();
149      insertIntoTable(conn, table1, mobName, 3, NB_ROWS_FAM3).close();
150      Admin admin = conn.getAdmin();
151      BackupAdminImpl client = new BackupAdminImpl(conn);
152      BackupRequest request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.FULL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
153      String backupIdFull = takeFullBackup(tables, client);
154      validateRootPathCanBeOverridden(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, backupIdFull);
155      assertTrue(checkSucceeded(backupIdFull));
156
157      // #2 - insert some data to table
158      Table t1 = insertIntoTable(conn, table1, famName, 1, ADD_ROWS);
159      LOG.debug("writing " + ADD_ROWS + " rows to " + table1);
160      Assert.assertEquals(HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(t1),
161        NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + ADD_ROWS + NB_ROWS_FAM3);
162      LOG.debug("written " + ADD_ROWS + " rows to " + table1);
163      // additionally, insert rows to MOB cf
164      int NB_ROWS_MOB = 111;
165      insertIntoTable(conn, table1, mobName, 3, NB_ROWS_MOB);
166      LOG.debug("written " + NB_ROWS_MOB + " rows to " + table1 + " to Mob enabled CF");
167      t1.close();
168      Assert.assertEquals(HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(t1),
169        NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + ADD_ROWS + NB_ROWS_MOB);
170      Table t2 = conn.getTable(table2);
171      Put p2;
172      for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
173        p2 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("row-t2" + i));
174        p2.addColumn(famName, qualName, Bytes.toBytes("val" + i));
175        t2.put(p2);
176      }
177      Assert.assertEquals(NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + 5, HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(t2));
178      t2.close();
179      LOG.debug("written " + 5 + " rows to " + table2);
180      // split table1
181      SingleProcessHBaseCluster cluster = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster();
182      List<HRegion> regions = cluster.getRegions(table1);
183      byte[] name = regions.get(0).getRegionInfo().getRegionName();
184      long startSplitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
185      try {
186        admin.splitRegionAsync(name).get();
187      } catch (Exception e) {
188        // although split fail, this may not affect following check in current API,
189        // exception will be thrown.
190        LOG.debug("region is not splittable, because " + e);
191      }
192      TEST_UTIL.waitTableAvailable(table1);
193      long endSplitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
194      // split finished
195      LOG.debug("split finished in =" + (endSplitTime - startSplitTime));
196
197      // #3 - incremental backup for multiple tables
198      tables = Lists.newArrayList(table1, table2);
199      request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.INCREMENTAL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
200      String backupIdIncMultiple = client.backupTables(request);
201      assertTrue(checkSucceeded(backupIdIncMultiple));
202      BackupManifest manifest =
203        HBackupFileSystem.getManifest(conf1, new Path(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR), backupIdIncMultiple);
204      assertEquals(Sets.newHashSet(table1, table2), new HashSet<>(manifest.getTableList()));
205      validateRootPathCanBeOverridden(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, backupIdIncMultiple);
206
207      // add column family f2 to table1
208      // drop column family f3
209      final byte[] fam2Name = Bytes.toBytes("f2");
210      newTable1Desc = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(newTable1Desc)
211        .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam2Name)).removeColumnFamily(fam3Name)
212        .build();
213      TEST_UTIL.getAdmin().modifyTable(newTable1Desc);
214
215      // check that an incremental backup fails because the CFs don't match
216      final List<TableName> tablesCopy = tables;
217      IOException ex = assertThrows(IOException.class, () -> client
218        .backupTables(createBackupRequest(BackupType.INCREMENTAL, tablesCopy, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR)));
219      checkThrowsCFMismatch(ex, List.of(table1));
220      takeFullBackup(tables, client);
221
222      int NB_ROWS_FAM2 = 7;
223      Table t3 = insertIntoTable(conn, table1, fam2Name, 2, NB_ROWS_FAM2);
224      t3.close();
225
226      // Wait for 5 sec to make sure that old WALs were deleted
227      Thread.sleep(5000);
228
229      // #4 - additional incremental backup for multiple tables
230      request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.INCREMENTAL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
231      String backupIdIncMultiple2 = client.backupTables(request);
232      assertTrue(checkSucceeded(backupIdIncMultiple2));
233      validateRootPathCanBeOverridden(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, backupIdIncMultiple2);
234
235      // #5 - restore full backup for all tables
236      TableName[] tablesRestoreFull = new TableName[] { table1, table2 };
237      TableName[] tablesMapFull = new TableName[] { table1_restore, table2_restore };
238
239      LOG.debug("Restoring full " + backupIdFull);
240      client.restore(BackupUtils.createRestoreRequest(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, backupIdFull, false,
241        tablesRestoreFull, tablesMapFull, true));
242
243      // #6.1 - check tables for full restore
244      Admin hAdmin = TEST_UTIL.getAdmin();
245      assertTrue(hAdmin.tableExists(table1_restore));
246      assertTrue(hAdmin.tableExists(table2_restore));
247      hAdmin.close();
248
249      // #6.2 - checking row count of tables for full restore
250      Table hTable = conn.getTable(table1_restore);
251      Assert.assertEquals(HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(hTable), NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + NB_ROWS_FAM3);
252      hTable.close();
253
254      hTable = conn.getTable(table2_restore);
255      Assert.assertEquals(NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH, HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(hTable));
256      hTable.close();
257
258      // #7 - restore incremental backup for multiple tables, with overwrite
259      TableName[] tablesRestoreIncMultiple = new TableName[] { table1, table2 };
260      TableName[] tablesMapIncMultiple = new TableName[] { table1_restore, table2_restore };
261      client.restore(BackupUtils.createRestoreRequest(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, backupIdIncMultiple2, false,
262        tablesRestoreIncMultiple, tablesMapIncMultiple, true));
263      hTable = conn.getTable(table1_restore);
264
265      LOG.debug("After incremental restore: " + hTable.getDescriptor());
266      int countFamName = TEST_UTIL.countRows(hTable, famName);
267      LOG.debug("f1 has " + countFamName + " rows");
268      Assert.assertEquals(countFamName, NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + ADD_ROWS);
269
270      int countFam2Name = TEST_UTIL.countRows(hTable, fam2Name);
271      LOG.debug("f2 has " + countFam2Name + " rows");
272      Assert.assertEquals(countFam2Name, NB_ROWS_FAM2);
273
274      int countMobName = TEST_UTIL.countRows(hTable, mobName);
275      LOG.debug("mob has " + countMobName + " rows");
276      Assert.assertEquals(countMobName, NB_ROWS_MOB);
277      hTable.close();
278
279      hTable = conn.getTable(table2_restore);
280      Assert.assertEquals(NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + 5, HBaseTestingUtil.countRows(hTable));
281      hTable.close();
282      admin.close();
283    }
284  }
285
286  @Test
287  public void TestIncBackupRestoreWithOriginalSplits() throws Exception {
288    byte[] mobFam = Bytes.toBytes("mob");
289
290    List<TableName> tables = Lists.newArrayList(table1);
291    TableDescriptor newTable1Desc =
292      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(table1Desc).setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder
293        .newBuilder(mobFam).setMobEnabled(true).setMobThreshold(5L).build()).build();
294    TEST_UTIL.getAdmin().modifyTable(newTable1Desc);
295
296    Connection conn = TEST_UTIL.getConnection();
297    BackupAdminImpl backupAdmin = new BackupAdminImpl(conn);
298    BackupRequest request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.FULL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
299    String fullBackupId = backupAdmin.backupTables(request);
300    assertTrue(checkSucceeded(fullBackupId));
301
302    TableName[] fromTables = new TableName[] { table1 };
303    TableName[] toTables = new TableName[] { table1_restore };
304
305    List<LocatedFileStatus> preRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
306    backupAdmin.restore(BackupUtils.createRestoreRequest(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, fullBackupId, false,
307      fromTables, toTables, true, true));
308    List<LocatedFileStatus> postRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
309
310    // Check that the backup files are the same before and after the restore process
311    Assert.assertEquals(postRestoreBackupFiles, preRestoreBackupFiles);
312    Assert.assertEquals(TEST_UTIL.countRows(table1_restore), NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH);
313
314    int ROWS_TO_ADD = 1_000;
315    // different IDs so that rows don't overlap
316    insertIntoTable(conn, table1, famName, 3, ROWS_TO_ADD);
317    insertIntoTable(conn, table1, mobFam, 4, ROWS_TO_ADD);
318
319    try (Admin admin = conn.getAdmin()) {
320      List<HRegion> currentRegions = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getRegions(table1);
321      for (HRegion region : currentRegions) {
322        byte[] name = region.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes();
323        admin.splitRegionAsync(name).get();
324      }
325
326      TEST_UTIL.waitTableAvailable(table1);
327
328      // Make sure we've split regions
329      assertNotEquals(currentRegions, TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getRegions(table1));
330
331      request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.INCREMENTAL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
332      String incrementalBackupId = backupAdmin.backupTables(request);
333      assertTrue(checkSucceeded(incrementalBackupId));
334      preRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
335      backupAdmin.restore(BackupUtils.createRestoreRequest(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, incrementalBackupId,
336        false, fromTables, toTables, true, true));
337      postRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
338      Assert.assertEquals(postRestoreBackupFiles, preRestoreBackupFiles);
339      Assert.assertEquals(NB_ROWS_IN_BATCH + ROWS_TO_ADD + ROWS_TO_ADD,
340        TEST_UTIL.countRows(table1_restore));
341
342      // test bulkloads
343      HRegion regionToBulkload = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getRegions(table1).get(0);
344      String regionName = regionToBulkload.getRegionInfo().getEncodedName();
345
346      insertIntoTable(conn, table1, famName, 5, ROWS_TO_ADD);
347      insertIntoTable(conn, table1, mobFam, 6, ROWS_TO_ADD);
348
349      doBulkload(table1, regionName, famName, mobFam);
350
351      // we need to major compact the regions to make sure there are no references
352      // and the regions are once again splittable
353      TEST_UTIL.compact(true);
354      TEST_UTIL.flush();
355      TEST_UTIL.waitTableAvailable(table1);
356
357      for (HRegion region : TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getRegions(table1)) {
358        if (region.isSplittable()) {
359          admin.splitRegionAsync(region.getRegionInfo().getEncodedNameAsBytes()).get();
360        }
361      }
362
363      request = createBackupRequest(BackupType.INCREMENTAL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
364      incrementalBackupId = backupAdmin.backupTables(request);
365      assertTrue(checkSucceeded(incrementalBackupId));
366
367      preRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
368      backupAdmin.restore(BackupUtils.createRestoreRequest(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR, incrementalBackupId,
369        false, fromTables, toTables, true, true));
370      postRestoreBackupFiles = getBackupFiles();
371
372      Assert.assertEquals(postRestoreBackupFiles, preRestoreBackupFiles);
373
374      int rowsExpected = TEST_UTIL.countRows(table1);
375      int rowsActual = TEST_UTIL.countRows(table1_restore);
376
377      Assert.assertEquals(rowsExpected, rowsActual);
378    }
379  }
380
381  private void checkThrowsCFMismatch(IOException ex, List<TableName> tables) {
382    Throwable cause = Throwables.getRootCause(ex);
383    assertEquals(cause.getClass(), ColumnFamilyMismatchException.class);
384    ColumnFamilyMismatchException e = (ColumnFamilyMismatchException) cause;
385    assertEquals(tables, e.getMismatchedTables());
386  }
387
388  private String takeFullBackup(List<TableName> tables, BackupAdminImpl backupAdmin)
389    throws IOException {
390    BackupRequest req = createBackupRequest(BackupType.FULL, tables, BACKUP_ROOT_DIR);
391    String backupId = backupAdmin.backupTables(req);
392    checkSucceeded(backupId);
393    return backupId;
394  }
395
396  private static void doBulkload(TableName tn, String regionName, byte[]... fams)
397    throws IOException {
398    Path regionDir = createHFiles(tn, regionName, fams);
399    Map<BulkLoadHFiles.LoadQueueItem, ByteBuffer> results =
400      BulkLoadHFiles.create(conf1).bulkLoad(tn, regionDir);
401    assertFalse(results.isEmpty());
402  }
403
404  private static Path createHFiles(TableName tn, String regionName, byte[]... fams)
405    throws IOException {
406    Path rootdir = CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(conf1);
407    Path regionDir = CommonFSUtils.getRegionDir(rootdir, tn, regionName);
408
409    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
410    fs.mkdirs(rootdir);
411
412    for (byte[] fam : fams) {
413      Path famDir = new Path(regionDir, Bytes.toString(fam));
414      Path hFileDir = new Path(famDir, UUID.randomUUID().toString());
415      HFileTestUtil.createHFile(conf1, fs, hFileDir, fam, qualName, BULKLOAD_START_KEY,
416        BULKLOAD_END_KEY, 1000);
417    }
418
419    return regionDir;
420  }
421
422  /**
423   * Check that backup manifest can be produced for a different root. Users may want to move
424   * existing backups to a different location.
425   */
426  private void validateRootPathCanBeOverridden(String originalPath, String backupId)
427    throws IOException {
428    String anotherRootDir = "/some/other/root/dir";
429    Path anotherPath = new Path(anotherRootDir, backupId);
430    BackupManifest.BackupImage differentLocationImage = BackupManifest.hydrateRootDir(
431      HBackupFileSystem.getManifest(conf1, new Path(originalPath), backupId).getBackupImage(),
432      anotherPath);
433    assertEquals(differentLocationImage.getRootDir(), anotherRootDir);
434    for (BackupManifest.BackupImage ancestor : differentLocationImage.getAncestors()) {
435      assertEquals(anotherRootDir, ancestor.getRootDir());
436    }
437  }
438
439  private List<LocatedFileStatus> getBackupFiles() throws IOException {
440    FileSystem fs = TEST_UTIL.getTestFileSystem();
441    RemoteIterator<LocatedFileStatus> iter = fs.listFiles(new Path(BACKUP_ROOT_DIR), true);
442    List<LocatedFileStatus> files = new ArrayList<>();
443
444    while (iter.hasNext()) {
445      files.add(iter.next());
446    }
447
448    return files;
449  }
450}
